paper.title: Phase-curve Evidence for an Atmosphere on TRAPPIST-1 b

core_question: Does JWST MIRI phase-curve data for TRAPPIST-1 b require an atmosphere instead of a bare-rock no-atmosphere interpretation?

datasets_or_cohorts.label: Observed TRAPPIST-1 b phase-curve system
datasets_or_cohorts.sample_size_or_observations: phase-resolved JWST MIRI thermal spectra from one rocky exoplanet
datasets_or_cohorts.description: One-rocky planet dataset comprising orbital phase-curve thermal spectroscopy used to infer day-night temperature structure and spectral structure.

datasets_or_cohorts.label: Null no-atmosphere model
datasets_or_cohorts.sample_size_or_observations: model comparison against the observed phase curve and spectrum
datasets_or_cohorts.description: Bare-rock hypothesis with minimal heat redistribution used as a baseline model to test whether a vacuum-like planet can fit both observables together.

datasets_or_cohorts.label: CO2-rich atmospheric retrieval
datasets_or_cohorts.sample_size_or_observations: same observed dataset interpreted under CO2-dominated atmospheric priors
datasets_or_cohorts.description: Atmospheric model emphasizing strong 15 um CO2 absorption features and moderate-pressure structure to explain phase and spectral behavior.

datasets_or_cohorts.label: O2-rich atmospheric retrieval
datasets_or_cohorts.sample_size_or_observations: same observed dataset interpreted under oxidized-atmosphere priors
datasets_or_cohorts.description: Alternative atmospheric family with weaker CO2 constraints, retained as viable because current data do not fully exclude this composition family.

major_limitations: This is a single-planet study and does not establish atmospheric prevalence across all M-dwarf rocky planets.
Retrieval assumptions for circulation, opacity priors, and cloud treatment materially affect quantitative posterior interpretations.
Stellar variability and instrument systematics can bias weak spectral features in the reported data.
Night-side constraints are weaker than day-side constraints in the current dataset.
